body_html:
Yeah, it would probably best to cite both the paper and the Zenodo archive.

Maybe sth like

“... we used PyTorch (Paszke et al.) version 0.3 (Zenodo and/or GitHub link)”

My guess though why Zenodo is not included in academic citation databases is prob more due to the fact that the uploads are not peer reviewed. This is also semi-true for arxiv articles (Google Scholar includes them whereas the more classic ones don’t).
